page.title: 11Worksop Manor Heritage
page.content: To the far N of the block lies the grand Worksop Manor at the centre of its large estate. Its present form owes a lot to earlier buildings on the same site. The first great house was built by the 6th Earl of Shrewsbury (Bess of Hardwicks 4th and last husband) during the 1570's. This fine building, designed by Robert Smythson, outshone other such buildings of the period. By marriage the Manor became the property of the Dukes of Norfolk but unfortunately it was burnt down in 1761. James Paine was given the task of designing the new house. Building began but came to an abrupt halt following the death of the heir. In 1839 the 12th Duke sold the Manor and the Estate to the 4th Duke of Newcastle who, as he already had a nearby Manor, pulled it down.
